author: popef
content: Is anyone interested in seeing the simulation/testing of peerdas in Ethshadow? (https://github.com/ethereum/ethshadow) Its benefit over devnets is it's more scalable (I hypothesize that it can go as high as 500-1,000 nodes), but it's less realistic of course. I'm asking to see if there is enough interest.

author: parithosh
content: The main limitation i see in ethshadow is the client selection, so imo it helps to use it to decide if we're doing research decisions. However peerDAS right now should really be moving into the shipping stage, where simulations shouldn't be needed anymore (or if they are, then we need to adjust our timelines for when this hits mainnet)

author: popef
content: that makes sense

content: Test Vectors

author: barnabasbusa
content:
I'm testing with lh and nethermind + geth, and interesting that LH reports:
`Apr 04 12:33:30.001 WARN Not ready for Fulu                            hint: "try updating the execution endpoint", info: Execution endpoint does not support Fulu methods: Required Methods Unsupported: engine_getPayloadV5 engine_newPayloadV4` for nethermind, but doesn't report the same for geth. (pre fulu activation).

author: barnabasbusa
content:
looks like ```
  - el_type: nethermind
    el_image: ethpandaops/nethermind:feature-peerdas
    cl_type: lighthouse
    cl_image: ethpandaops/lighthouse:peerdas-devnet-6
``` is no longer working

author: barnabasbusa
content: I'll have to go back a few commits and see where it broke

author: marcinds
content: I just pushed a fix for osaka capabilities activation, we were enabling it together with prague ones and sending warnings

content: Still weird lh reports them as not supported

content: still the same branch? feature/peerdas? I just built an image and its still borked.

author: marcinds
content: <@412614104222531604> we were enabling this methods together with prague (so at least one of eips 7251, 7002 or 6110). Fixed it and now we are enabling everything based on 7594

author: barnabasbusa
content: `Apr 04 13:26:44.008 WARN Not ready for Fulu                            hint: "try updating the execution endpoint", info: Execution endpoint does not support Fulu methods: Required Methods Unsupported: engine_newPayloadV4`

content: let me push a fix

content: i can test deneb genesis and go from there

author: barnabasbusa
content: as that worked yesterday

author: marcinds
content: Lh was reporting `engine_getPayloadV5` and `engine_newPayloadV4`, I fixed `engine_getPayloadV5`  to be enabled with eip7594 and now it reports only `engine_newPayloadV4` so seems like Prague is somehow not activated. In our code it is enabled with `IsEip7251Enabled || IsEip7002Enabled || IsEip6110Enabled`

author: barnabasbusa
content: what if those values are 0?

author: barnabasbusa
content: should it become activated at genesis?

author: barnabasbusa
content: So starting with deneb, going through electra, then going into fulu, lh doesn't report this issue anymore

author: barnabasbusa
content: so def. something to do with how you handle electra genesis ðŸ˜„

author: barnabasbusa
content: I messed up

author: barnabasbusa
content: I accidently deleted electra_fork_epoch, where this would be defaulting to high number still, so basically it tried to go through fulu before going through electra. Fixed the config locally, should work now, apologies for making noise.

content: No problem, it forced us to improve the code a bit
